hanzi-su-wiki:
矯

Значения

Исправлять, выправлять, гнуть, искажать; фальшивый, поддельный

Мнемоника

Выпрямлять кривую и короткую стрелу 矢, пытаясь выдать её за длинную 喬, большущую.

Варианты

矫
purpleculture_pinyin:
jiáo
argumentative; contentious
аргументированный; спорный

jiǎo
surname Jiao; to correct; to rectify; to redress; strong; brave; to pretend; to feign; affectation
фамилия Цзяо; исправлять; исправить; исправить; сильный; Храбрый; притворяться; притворяться; притворство
rtega_mnemonic:
矯矯RS
矫矫		correct, rectify, straighten out, brave
  • brave arrow 矢 shot from a high 喬/乔 position to rectify a military situation
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 矫)
Pictophonetic: 喬 indicates the sound; 矢 (arrow) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
矯情 [ jiáo qing ]: (Beijing dialect) argumentative; unreasonable
矯正 [ jiǎo zhèng ]: to correct; to rectify (e.g. a physical defect such as hearing or vision); to cure; rectification; correction; to straighten
矯健 [ jiǎo jiàn ]: strong and healthy; vigorous
矯情 [ jiǎo qíng ]: affected; unnatural; pretentious
矯揉造作 [ jiǎo róu zào zuò ]: pretension; affectation; putting on artificial airs
矯治 [ jiǎo zhì ]: to correct (e.g. sight or hearing); to rectify; to cure

• ⿰ Left to right
    • 矢 [ shǐ ] arrow, dart; to vow, to swear
    • 喬 [ qiáo ] tall, lofty; proud, stately
heisig_chinese_memo: Angels have now been given a powerful tool to rectify human behavior instantly, without delay - they have been allowed to drop darts on those who misbehave... spare the dart and spoil the man...
heisig_constituent: rectify, dart, drop, heavens, angel, heavens, mouth, hood, mouth, mouth2
Keyword_KANJIDIC: rectify, straighten, correct, reform, cure, control, pretend, falsify
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: Устранить, выпрямить, правильное, реформа, лечение, контроль, делает вид, фальсифицировать
koohiiStory1: Angels have now been given a powerful tool to rectify human behavior instantly, without delay - they have been allowed to drop darts on those who misbehave... spare the dart and spoil the man...
koohiiStory2: The darts of the angel Cupid are supposed to bring people joy, but usually just make things a lot worse. Here we see another angel flying around shooting people with the anti-darts (antidote), to rectify the situation.
WaniKani_Radicals: 矢, 天, 口, 冋
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: An arrow is shot from heaven and hits right between your mouth and your mustache to correct your crooked smile. It also straightens your teeth and the crooked cut of your mustache too. Who told you that looked good? Well, it doesn't matter. The heaven arrow corrected it for you.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: An arrow from heaven will correct all your problems!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: These heavenly correcting arrows actually come from きょうと. They hate seeing people with crooked mustaches, so they shoot them out on the regular. It just looks like they're coming from heaven because they fall out of the sky.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you want someone to correct your teeth or mustache, just wander around きょうと, staring up at the sky. Then when you see an arrow, run for it and try to catch it with your face!
Ru_Meaning: rectify, straighten, correct, reform, cure, control, pretend, falsify
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 喬 (たかい、キョウ высокий).
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 口 (рот), 大 (большой), 矢 (стрела)
Ru_trainchinese: jiǎo: (глаг/прил) исправлять, корректировать; искусственно подыскивать, изобретать (напр. предлог); крепкий, сильный, мощный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the lofty (喬) arrow (矢) is straightened
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An angel can rectify wrong doings by shooting a magic dart into the person which turns their soul good and forces them to do good things for the rest of their lives.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " vector " and " Qiao ", the original meaning is to make the tune straight. "Shuowen": "Knead the arrow and pincers. From the arrow, Qiao's voice." Xu Hao's note: "Knead the arrow to make it straight." "Yi‧Said Gua": "The ridge is water, it is ditch, it is hidden, it is Correction is a bow wheel." Kong Yingdashu: "The one who makes the curve straight is correcting, and the one who makes the straight curve is straight, and the flow of water is straight, so it is correcting."

" Correcting " can mean correcting and correcting. "Han Feizi-Lonely Indignation": "A person who is capable of the law, he listens hard and uses it, and he is aggressive."

" Correct " also means suppression. "Mo Zi‧ Fei Mingxia": "Instead of correcting the desires of the ears and eyes, but interpreting the desires of his mind."

" Jiao " also means encouragement and encouragement. "Zhuangzi‧ Tianxia": "Using Shengmo to correct itself, and to prepare for the world's urgency." Guo Xiang's note: "Jiao, Li Ye." Cheng Xuanying Shu: "Use benevolence and righteousness as Shengmo, to force his will."

" Correction " also means rebellion and violation. "Guan Zi‧ Monarchs and Ministers": "The things above and below are called corrections, and the things below and above are called victory. Corrections for the top, contradictions, and victory for the bottom, and rebellion."

" Correction " can also mean false claims and fraudulent claims. "The Thirty-three Years of Gong Yang Chuan-Gong Yang": "Those with high strings, Zheng merchants, if they are confused, they will treat their teachers by the orders of Uncle Zheng." He Xiu's note: "Fraud is called correction."

" Jiao " also refers to it. "Songs of the Chu‧Nine Chapters‧Reflecting Thoughts": "Comment on micro-affairs with old words, correcting with widows and beauties." Wang Yi's note: "Ju and Huai Wang's ambassador to view photos." Zhu Xi's notes: "Jiao, Ju also ."

" Jiao " also refers to being strong and vigorous. "Book of Rites‧ The Doctrine of the Mean": "So the gentleman is in harmony but not fluent, the strong is correct." Kong Yingda Shu: "To correct, also to be strong."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " vector " and " Qiao ", the original meaning is to make the tune straight.
humanum_full_description:
從「矢」，「喬」聲，本義為使曲變直。《說文》：「揉箭箝也。从矢，喬聲。」徐灝箋：「揉箭欲其直也。」 《易‧說卦》：「坎為水，為溝瀆，為隱伏，為矯輮，為弓輪。」孔穎達疏：「使曲者直為矯，使直者曲為輮，水流曲直故為矯輮也。」

　　「矯」可表示匡正、糾正。《韓非子‧孤憤》：「能法之士，勁直聽用，且矯重人之姦行。」

　　「矯」也表示抑制。《墨子‧非命下》：「不而矯其耳目之欲，而從其心意之辟。」

　　「矯」還表示策勵、勉勵。《莊子‧天下》：「以繩墨自矯，而備世之急。」郭象注：「矯，厲也。」成玄英疏：「用仁義為繩墨，以勉厲其志行也。」

　　「矯」亦表示拂逆、違背。《管子‧君臣上》：「是以上及下之事謂之矯，下及上之事謂之勝。為上而矯，悖也；為下而勝，逆也。」

　　「矯」還可表示假托、詐稱。《公羊傳‧僖公三十三年》：「弦高者，鄭商人，遇之殽，矯以鄭伯之命而犒師焉。」何休注：「詐稱曰矯。」

　　「矯」也指舉。《楚辭‧九章‧抽思》：「結微情以陳詞兮，矯以遺夫美人。」王逸注：「舉與懷王使覽照也。」朱熹集注：「矯，舉也。」

　　「矯」還指強健、雄健。《禮記‧中庸》：「故君子和而不流，強者矯。」孔穎達疏：「矯，亦強也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「矢」，「喬」聲，本義為使曲變直。

①(矯情)方言，指強詞奪理，無理取鬧，如“這個人太矯矯”，(“情”讀輕聲)。
矯情 [ jiáo qing ]: (Beijing dialect) argumentative; unreasonable
①糾正，把彎曲的弄直：矯正。矯形。矯治。矯世(矯正世俗)。矯情(故意違反常態，表示與衆不同)。矯枉過正。
②假託：矯命。矯詔。矯虔(官吏假託上命掠奪百姓的財物)。
③強壯，勇武：矯健。矯捷。矯矯(ａ．勇武的樣子；b．出衆的樣子)。
④姓氏。

從「 矢 」，「 喬 」聲，本義為使曲變直。《說文》：「揉箭箝也。从矢，喬聲。」徐灝箋：「揉箭欲其直也。」 《易‧說卦》：「坎為水，為溝瀆，為隱伏，為矯輮，為弓輪。」孔穎達疏：「使曲者直為矯，使直者曲為輮，水流曲直故為矯輮也。」 「 矯 」可表示匡正、糾正。《韓非子‧孤憤》：「能法之士，勁直聽用，且矯重人之姦行。」 「 矯 」也表示抑制。《墨子‧非命下》：「不而矯其耳目之欲，而從其心意之辟。」 「 矯 」還表示策勵、勉勵。《莊子‧天下》：「以繩墨自矯，而備世之急。」郭象注：「矯，厲也。」成玄英疏：「用仁義為繩墨，以勉厲其志行也。」 「 矯 」亦表示拂逆、違背。《管子‧君臣上》：「是以上及下之事謂之矯，下及上之事謂之勝。為上而矯，悖也；為下而勝，逆也。」 「 矯 」還可表示假托、詐稱。《公羊傳‧僖公三十三年》：「弦高者，鄭商人，遇之殽，矯以鄭伯之命而犒師焉。」何休注：「詐稱曰矯。」 「 矯 」也指舉。《楚辭‧九章‧抽思》：「結微情以陳詞兮，矯以遺夫美人。」王逸注：「舉與懷王使覽照也。」朱熹集注：「矯，舉也。」 「 矯 」還指強健、雄健。《禮記‧中庸》：「故君子和而不流，強者矯。」孔穎達疏：「矯，亦強也。」

Xu Hao's note: "Knead the arrow to make it straight." "Yi‧Said Gua": "The ridge is water, it is ditch, it is hidden, it is Correction is a bow wheel." Kong Yingdashu: "The one who makes the curve straight is correcting, and the one who makes the straight curve is straight, and the flow of water is straight, so it is correcting." " Correcting" can mean correcting and correcting. "Han Feizi-Lonely Indignation": "A person who is capable of the law, he listens hard and uses it, and he is aggressive." " Correct" also means suppression. "Mo Zi‧ Fei Mingxia": "Instead of correcting the desires of the ears and eyes, but interpreting the desires of his mind." 矯字的基本解释

矯
jiǎo

矯
jiáo
均见“矫”。

矯字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiǎo］
［《廣韻》居夭切，上小，見。］
“矫1”的繁体字。
(1)使曲的变直。
(2)匡正；纠正。
(3)抑制。
(4)策励；勉励。
(5)拂逆，违背。
(6)杂糅。
(7)假托；诈称。
(8)专指假托君命。参见“矯殺”、“矯罪”。
(9)高举。
(10)立，指君主即位。
(11)强健；雄健。
(12)灵活；迅捷。参见“矯捷”。
(13)飞。
(14)姓。明有矫九高。见朱保炯谢沛霖《明清进士题名碑录索引》。
[②]［jiāo］
［《集韻》居妖切，平宵，見。］
“矫2”的繁体字。
古代投壶，箭从壶中跃出而手接之复投谓之“矯”。也称为“驍”。

矯字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【矢字部】　矯； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页825第24
【唐韻】居夭切【集韻】【韻會】舉夭切，?驕上聲。【說文】揉箭箝也。【搏雅】直也。【禮·部韻略】揉曲爲矯。【易·說卦】坎爲矯輮。【疏】使曲者直爲矯，使直者曲爲輮。【史記·平津侯傳】矯矢累弦。【註】正曲使直也。【前漢·成帝詔】民彌惰怠，將何以矯之。【註】矯，正也。【劉勰·新論】搒檠者，矯不正也。　又【玉篇】詐也，擅也。【類篇】妄也。【字彙】託也。通作撟。【書·呂?】奪攘矯虔。【前漢·高帝詔】作撟虔。【註】稱詐爲矯，强取爲虔。【左傳·昭二十六年】矯誣先王。【史記·汲黯傳】矯制持節，發河南倉廩，以振貧民。【前漢·高帝紀】羽矯殺卿子冠軍。【註】托懷王命而殺之也。【大戴禮】非其事而居之，矯也。　又【爾雅·釋訓】矯矯，勇也。【博雅】武也。【詩·魯頌】矯矯虎臣。【周頌】作蹻蹻。【註】武貌。　又强也。【禮·中庸】强哉矯。【荀子·臣道篇】作撟然剛折。【註】强貌。　又【類篇】舉也。【陶潛·歸去來辭】時矯首而遐觀。【揚雄·甘泉賦】作撟首。　又【博雅】飛也。【孫綽·遊天台

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiǎo］
["Guangyun" Juyao cut, upper elementary school, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "Jiao 1".
(1) Make the curve straight.
(2) Correction; correction.
(3) Inhibition.
(4) Encouragement; Encouragement.
(5) Rebellion, violation.
(6) Miscellaneous.
(7) False trust; fraudulent claim.
(8) It refers specifically to the false trust of the king. See "correction killing", "correction".
(9) Hold high.
(10) Li, refers to the ascendancy of the monarch.
(11) Strong; vigorous.
(12) Flexible; fast. See "flexibility".
(13) Fly.
(14) Last name. Ming has nine heights. See Zhu Baojiong and Xie Peilin, Index to the Records of the Ming and Qing Jinshi Titles.
[②]［jiāo］
["Ji Yun" live in the demon cut, flat night, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "Jiao 2".
In ancient times, throwing the pot, the arrow jumps out of the pot and the re-casting is called "correction". Also called "Snap".

Name meaning
Nothing.
jiǎo, jiāo
вм. 矫
Radicals: 矢, 天, 口, 冋  (arrow, heaven, mouth, mustache)
Meaning Mnemonic
An arrow is shot from heaven and hits right between your mouth and your mustache to correct your crooked smile. It also straightens your teeth and the crooked cut of your mustache too. Who told you that looked good? Well, it doesn't matter. The heaven arrow corrected it for you.
An arrow from heaven will correct all your problems!
Reading Mnemonic
These heavenly correcting arrows actually come from きょうと. They hate seeing people with crooked mustaches, so they shoot them out on the regular. It just looks like they're coming from heaven because they fall out of the sky.
If you want someone to correct your teeth or mustache, just wander around きょうと, staring up at the sky. Then when you see an arrow, run for it and try to catch it with your face!
